references.paper_title: Vision-and-language navigation: Interpreting visually-grounded navigation instructions in real environments
references.reason: This paper introduces the Vision-Language Navigation task, which is the central problem addressed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Learning to navigate unseen environments: Back translation with environmental dropout
references.reason: This paper is cited as one of the most influential works for its approach to vision-language navigation using back-translation and addressing the problem of unseen environments.

references.paper_title: VLN-BERT: A recurrent vision-and-language BERT for navigation
references.reason: This paper proposes a strong baseline model using the BERT architecture that is extensively compared against in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Think global, act local: Dual-scale graph transformer for vision-and-language navigation
references.reason: This paper is among the state-of-the-art methods at the time of publication and is used as a strong comparison point in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Beyond the nav-graph: Vision-and-language navigation in continuous environments
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it addresses the more challenging continuous environment version of the task, which is also tackled by the target paper.
